title: Required Data
name: required
text: Please confirm which data you are contributing towards the IMBIE gravimetry experiment group.

questions.name: spherical-harmonics-sheets
questions.text: 1a. Time-series of mass change, mass change uncertainty, and of observed area, computed including corrections for GIA, including Degree 1 contribution, including C20 contribution, and including corrections for leakage.

questions.name: spherical-harmonics-upload
questions.text: 1b. Upload a single, concatenated, time-series data file, following the IMBIE standard file format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, other than that required as part of your basic retrieval.

questions.name: mascons-approach-sheets
questions.text: 2a. Rates of mass change and their uncertainties, and the observed areas and time intervals over which these are calculated, computed including corrections for GIA, including Degree 1 contribution, including C20 contribution, and including corrections for leakage. Remember these data will form the basis of our mass balance aggregation, and so you should supply estimates for each region over as many time intervals as your method allows with confidence (your time intervals may overlap).

questions.name: mascons-approach-upload
questions.text: 2b. Upload a single, concatenated, time-series data file, following the IMBIE standard file format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, other than that required as part of your basic retrieval.

title: Supporting Information
name: supporting
text: Please answer the following questions in relation to the data you are submitting to the IMBIE gravimetry experiment group.

questions.name: general-methods
questions.text: 3. Which general method(s) have you employed to compute gravimetry mass balance?

questions.name: independent-observations
questions.text: 4. Which independent observations have you used to evaluate your gravimetry data set?

questions.name: gia-models
questions.text: 5. Which model(s) have you employed to account for glacial isostatic adjustment in your mass balance calculation?

questions.name: hydrology-leakage-models
questions.text: 6. Which model(s) have you employed to account for hydrology leakage in your mass balance calculation?

questions.name: ocean-leakage-models
questions.text: 7. Which model(s) have you employed to account for ocean leakage in your mass balance calculation?

questions.name: additional-leakage
questions.text: 8. Which additional source(s) of leakage have you accounted for in your mass balance calculation?

questions.name: degree-1-coefficients
questions.text: 9. Which degree 1 coefficients did you employ in your mass balance calculation?

questions.name: c20-coefficient
questions.text: 10. Which C20 coefficient did you employ in your mass balance calculation?

questions.name: methods-and-errors
questions.text: 11. Upload a document describing your mass balance methods and errors in full. This must be either a peer reviewed journal article or a document suitable for review by the IMBIE executive committee. (If you wish to upload multiple files, please upload them as a single .zip file)

title: Additional Experiments
name: additional
text: The IMBIE gravimetry experiment group may perform additional analyses to investigate methodological differences in more detail. These experiments are optional. If you wish to participate in the additional experiments, please confirm which data you are contributing.
